page.title: 18AMPORT PARISH MAGAZINE.
page.content: The Parish Magazine for Amport, Monxton, Grateley & Quarley is published monthly. The July issue, 1985, gives notice of Church Services & records baptisms, marriages & burials. The Vicar's letter concerns "Justice" & is followed by the results of the Christian Aid Week collection. There is a note of the local clergies' Quiet Day at Amport Vicarage on July 11th & a money-raising ploughman's lunch there on the 14th July. Money has been raised for Monxton Church gates & assistance is required for grass cutting in the churchyard. The Revd Michael Grylls was commissioned as Rural Dean at Grateley & bell- ringers rang a quarter peal of Bob Minor at Amport to celebrate. News of Parish Council meetings & Cricket Club Fixtures followed a Diary of the Month and Astronomical Notes.
